Yes, Cardiff hosts many Welsh language events and festivals throughout the year that are worth attending. Here are a few suggestions:

1. Eisteddfod Genedlaethol Cymru: This is a Welsh-language festival that takes place annually in different locations across Wales. The festival features music, art, literature, and other cultural events and is a great way to experience Welsh language and culture. 2. Tafwyl: Tafwyl is a free festival that celebrates Welsh language and culture. It is held every year in the city center of Cardiff and features live music, food and drink, dance performances, and family-friendly activities. 3. Cardiff and Vale Urdd National Eisteddfod: This is a Welsh language event that hosts a wide range of competitions in poetry, music, drama, and other arts. It is open to young people between the ages of 7 and 25 and is a great opportunity to meet other Welsh-speaking young people. 4. Welsh language theatre productions: Cardiff has several theaters that produce Welsh-language plays, such as Theatr Genedlaethol Cymru, Sherman Theatre, and Chapter Arts Centre. Attending a Welsh-language play is a great way to practice listening skills and experience Welsh culture. These are just a few examples of Welsh language events and festivals that Cardiff has to offer. You can find more information about these events and others by checking local event listings or Welsh-language media outlets.
